intro: Limniris koreana, commonly known as the Korean limniris, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Korea. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lanceolate, hairy leaves. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Limniris koreana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
